name: electricity production, deep geothermal | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14217/documentation

This data set is based on a data set comprised in the book 'Energy from the earth'. (see field 'published source' for more details). The inventory reflects the conditions for amounts with the reference flow of “1 kWh electricity, high voltage”. This inventory includes the following elements:;• Yearly losses of the working fluid of 8% are taken into account;• “Amount” of geothermal plant needed per 1 kWh calculated from the cumulative lifetime electricity production;The inventory does not consider the possibility of leakage of geofluid to an aquifer layer. This is not considered to be normal operation (see published source, WP5 “Risks”, Section 6.1.2.6 “Geofluids”). The inventory reflects Swiss conditions, used as first approximation. Uncertainties adjusted accordingly.

This dataset starts from commissioned geothermal power plants ready to generate electricity.

This activity ends with the high voltage electricity produced at the power plant.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2012.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Represents installation of a deep geothermal power plant in Germany and is based on plant data from Switzerland. Uncertainties adjusted accordingly.

publication.name: S Hirchberg, S Wiemer, P Burgherr2015
